body: Hi Chris, the window U value is 0.85; walls are at 0.17. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jraR8DGMXOg49f4bdDMjSBomNqrwtBefjKG5DSdngg08BYhM8ARJEoDnF0OZsBRa1vdjYkocrVYH2ZN1G86s3aaCQPYqPUq3/UVAL.PNG) **E+ constructions - windows and wall ** So the windows are, in fact, colder than the walls (by roughly 4°C) - see image below. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jraR8DGMXOicPj5dkuXDN8Gae0enqYYS83dRE4n-WhZbKNzlsBEV5mMQrUazn6xhKHZmz6MQWHYue065jpeH2*6ao3-jFX-2/UVAL2.jpg) **E+ data of average inner face temperatures (from 4 to 6; at 4 is similar)** I checked this early on to cross-reference it with the comf map outputs, and that's what led me to suspect something weird may be going on with them.  When you once again omit the schedule, air change and system setting assignment part of our script, you get the below comf map results: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jraR8DGMXOjrf2hZIbz73Yj*q6V0xvQUyQ9Ns15Aw8cxYqQ2hfa7rxP67tUEnzmD*llbylAslm46QTZXzbEQ9tFzF4ocSLUF/UVAL3.jpg) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jraR8DGMXOg49f4bdDMjSBomNqrwtBefjKG5DSdngg08BYhM8ARJEoDnF0OZsBRa1vdjYkocrVYH2ZN1G86s3aaCQPYqPUq3/UVAL.PNG)**Comf map output of CMAP script with ideal air / OS system, schedule and ac/h script section bypassed** When you set the programme in the CMAP script to Office:OpenOffice, you get an similar output: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jraR8DGMXOgfghN3FMRMykbG*PkJEEVEtXBPIdBb9dtK3LRx9WU7M75Z4-*uuz7yMywhajGlcKi7O8NJBrkZZF3kXWpMGlhK/UVAL4.jpg)**[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jraR8DGMXOg49f4bdDMjSBomNqrwtBefjKG5DSdngg08BYhM8ARJEoDnF0OZsBRa1vdjYkocrVYH2ZN1G86s3aaCQPYqPUq3/UVAL.PNG)Comf map output of CMAP script with ideal air / OS system, schedule and ac/h script section included, with Office:OpenOffice programme set** Once I switch to the MidriseAppartment:Appartment programme, even with the ideal air / OS system parameters bypassed in the script, I get the following: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jraR8DGMXOju8umM74XLixdHf9dwFp7qxr0dby9kpam7Hg8p6XjEllaq9C-mhZO7BYBmo*W6qyCGJeDIcoMYjRtD2wTvUA-f/UVAL5.jpg) **Comf map output of CMAP script with ideal air / OS system, schedule and ac/h script section included, with Appartment schedule set (same output whether ideal air part settings excluded or not).** Having stared at this "the men who stare at goats" style for quite some time now, I think I see the pattern now; the difference between the apartment and office programme is in the loads, etc. which mods the surf temps, which changes the distribution (and that one result you had that looked totally different did not reappear). As for the 'wash' of temperatures- yes.. granted, the U value of the glazing is pretty good; the spread of temperatures we are looking at is only about 0.3 degrees, on average. Maybe that simply *is* the distribution, and the E+ radiance temp output snapshot leads me down a false cognitive avenue, priming me to expect a different distribution than actually present? Best, Max
